newsitem.title: USA: Texas spot power prices again hold mostly steady.
newsitem.headline: Texas spot power prices again hold mostly steady.

text.p: Spot bulk power prices in the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) held mostly steady again Wednesday as mild temperatures continued to limit power demand in the state, industry sources said.
Temperatures were forecast to reach highs in the 60s and 70s degrees Fahrenheit area through Texas on Thursday, and longer term forecasts called for much above-normal temperatures from Jan 26 to 30.
ERCOT firm, peak power for a 16-hour block for Thursday delivery was pegged at $19.00-23.00 from $22.00-24.00 per megawatt hour (MWh) on Tuesday, the brokers and marketers said.
Non-firm on peak power was said to have been talked at $16.00-19.00 on Wednesday for Thursday delivery.
Firm off-peak next day ERCOT deliveries were assessed steady at $10.00-14.00, while non firm off peak power was pegged unchanged at $8.00-10.00 for Thursday delivery.
February ERCOT peak power was said to have eased to $27.25-27.75 from $27.50-27.85 on Tuesday, the sources said.

March ERCOT peak power was said to be discussed at $23.25-23.75 with one unconfirmed trade reported at $23.50, while June was talked at $23.50-24.50 and July/August was talked at $25.00-25.90 per MWh.
